children.name: Luk krung
children.description: Ballads influenced by Jazz styles like Swing and Big Band, as well as Hispanic American Music infused with Thai melodic and rhythmic sensibilities.

children.name: Luk thung
children.description: Slow tempo and vibrato singing, featuring a fusion of traditional Thai instrumentation, rhythms, and melodies with influences from Japan, Indonesia, Latin America, and the United States.

children.name: Molam sing
children.description: Modernized form featuring a faster pace and mostly electric instrumentation.

children.name: Phleng phuea chiwit
children.description: Political Thai Folk Rock born out of the 1973 student uprising, with a name translating to "songs for life".

children.name: Thai Classical Music
children.description: Emerged from the royal courts of Central Thailand around the 13th century, based on a traditional Thai sound-scale of seven tempered notes.

children.name: Thai Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Thai people.

children.name: Wong shadow
children.description: Small, short-lived guitar Pop movement in Thailand in the 1960s, fusing Surf Rock  with local melodies.
